summary: Sir Joseph John "J.J." Thomson, OM, FRS  was a British physicist and Nobel laureate.
full_text: The thomson  is a unit that has appeared infrequently in scientific literature relating to the field of mass spectrometry as a unit of mass-to-charge ratio. The unit was proposed by Cooks and Rockwood naming it in honour of J. J. Thomson who measured the mass-to-charge ratio of electrons and ions.
title: Thomson (unit)
